PropertyList.title: Cessna 337 Skymaster
PropertyList.line: 1.Turn ON battery and front and rear generators
2.Turn ON master avionics button (left wall panel)
4.Turn ON required lights and pitot heat
6.Turn ON rear magnetos, continue turning the knob for starter
7.Turn ON front magnetos, continue turning the knob for starter
PropertyList.text:
See "Equipment/Fuel and Payload" menu to adjust aircraft weights. Being able to adjust the weight of each passenger, take a tip: The rear seats works fine with kids or baggage, it's not recomended to fly with 6 adult passengers, due to balance issues.
The Cessna 337 Skymaster has a constant-speed propeller; so, you can increase propeller pitch to get more airspeed, but with a loss of engine RPM and power.
About knobs, use scroll mouse for gross adjustments, and left-central buttons for fine tunning. When setting radio frequencies, the mouse scroll will adjust integral numbers, and buttons will tune decimals.
There is a (temporary) guide to the Navomatic 400A autopilot in Models/Instruments/Navomatic/NAVOMATIC-400A-README.
